We are a place where Nigerians can find their trusted grocery brands at the best prices. Market Square was born from a passionate desire to create a modern, superiorshopping experience for Nigerians and a more convenient way for people to meet their everyday needs.

Our core team consists of young and experienced retail professionals with substantial knowledge of the modern retail environment. We recruit and continuously train our staff to ensure they are equipped to provide you with the best products and services at every location where we operate.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: IT Administrator
Job Location:&nbsp;Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	This role is responsible for day-to-day operation, maintenance and support of the company&rsquo;s Windows environment, M365 tenant, SQL Database, Endpoint devices (laptops/desktops), printers, network infrastructure (LAN, Wi?Fi AP, firewall), and Core Retail POS systems.
	Ensures reliable performance, security, and user support across offices and retail outlets; implements patches, backups, and standard operating procedures; coordinates with vendors and escalates complex issues.


Key Responsibilities


	Maintain and administer Windows servers, AD/Azure AD, group policies, DNS, DHCP, and related services.
	Manage Microsoft 365 tenant: user provisioning/deprovisioning, licensing, Exchange Online, Teams, OneDrive, security/compliance settings.
	Manage SQL server administration: Responsible for the overall management, maintenance, security, and operation of an organization&#39;s database systems that use Structured Query Language (SQL).
	Provide first- and second-line support for laptops, desktops, monitors and peripherals; perform setup, OS updates, patching, and hardware troubleshooting.
	Support and maintain printers/MFPs: configuration, drivers, consumables management, and vendor coordination for repairs.
	Manage and monitor network infrastructure: LAN switches, VLANs, Wi?Fi access points, network segmentation, and performance troubleshooting.
	Configure, maintain, and monitor firewalls and edge security: rule updates, VPNs, logging, firmware updates, and basic IDS/IPS alerts escalation.
	Monitor internet connectivity and network performance, proactively identifying and resolving issues.
	Administer and support Core Retail Software systems: user accounts, workstation configuration, connectivity, daily health checks, and coordination with POS vendor for upgrades and incident resolution.
	Provide user support for POS-specific issues (transactions, peripheral devices like barcode scanners, receipt printers, cash-drawers) and ensure high availability during business hours.
	Maintain inventory and asset management for all IT equipment; track warranties and lifecycle replacement schedules.
	Implement and operate backup and recovery processes for critical systems and data; regularly test restores and document procedures.
	Monitor system health and alerts; proactively identify issues and drive remediation or capacity planning.
	Apply security best practices: endpoint protection, patch management, account hygiene, multi-factor authentication, and basic incident response/playbook execution.
	Maintain documentation: runbooks, SOPs, network diagrams, configuration files, change logs, and knowledge base articles for common user issues.
	Coordinate with third-party vendors (ISP, POS provider, printer service, cloud providers) and manage service tickets and SLAs.
	Support onboarding/offboarding processes for employees including device provisioning, access rights, and secure data removal.
	Assist with IT projects and upgrades (Wi?Fi expansion, workstation refresh, feature rollouts, Store Opening) ensuring continuous service availability.
	Ensure compliance with company policies and applicable regulations for data protection and privacy.
	Provide after-hours support on an as-needed rotation or for critical incidents.
	Collaborate across board to ensure highest level of customer service delivery.


Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Computer Science, Information Security, or related fields
	3+ years IT admin experience in SQL Database environment with on-
	3+ year Network (WAN/LAN) support for Multi branch (locations) architecture.
	Hands-on experience with Active Directory/Azure AD, Microsoft 365, Windows 10/11 imaging, network fundamentals (TCP/IP, VLANs, DHCP), and firewall configuration.
	Hands on experience is windows server, VM and cloud computing.
	Familiarity with backup solutions, endpoint security, and basic cloud services.
	Strong customer-service orientation, troubleshooting skills, and clear documentation practices.
	Certifications preferred: Microsoft 365 Certified, CompTIA Network+/Security+, or relevant vendor certifications is a plus.


We offer


	A competitive compensation and benefits package
	A collaborative environment where we support each other to succeed as a team
	A value-based culture
	A diverse and inclusive environment
	Great learning and growth opportunities

We are a place where Nigerians can find their trusted grocery brands at the best prices. Market Square was born from a passionate desire to create a modern, superiorshopping experience for Nigerians and a more convenient way for people to meet their everyday needs.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: IT Administrator
Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	This role is responsible for day-to-day operation, maintenance and support of the company’s Windows environment, M365 tenant, SQL Database, Endpoint devices (laptops/desktops), printers, network infrastructure (LAN, Wi?Fi AP, firewall), and Core Retail POS systems.
	Ensures reliable performance, security, and user support across offices and retail outlets; implements patches, backups, and standard operating procedures; coordinates with vendors and escalates complex issues.


Key Responsibilities


	Maintain and administer Windows servers, AD/Azure AD, group policies, DNS, DHCP, and related services.
	Manage Microsoft 365 tenant: user provisioning/deprovisioning, licensing, Exchange Online, Teams, OneDrive, security/compliance settings.
	Manage SQL server administration: Responsible for the overall management, maintenance, security, and operation of an organization's database systems that use Structured Query Language (SQL).
	Provide first- and second-line support for laptops, desktops, monitors and peripherals; perform setup, OS updates, patching, and hardware troubleshooting.
	Support and maintain printers/MFPs: configuration, drivers, consumables management, and vendor coordination for repairs.
	Manage and monitor network infrastructure: LAN switches, VLANs, Wi?Fi access points, network segmentation, and performance troubleshooting.
	Configure, maintain, and monitor firewalls and edge security: rule updates, VPNs, logging, firmware updates, and basic IDS/IPS alerts escalation.
	Monitor internet connectivity and network performance, proactively identifying and resolving issues.
	Administer and support Core Retail Software systems: user accounts, workstation configuration, connectivity, daily health checks, and coordination with POS vendor for upgrades and incident resolution.
	Provide user support for POS-specific issues (transactions, peripheral devices like barcode scanners, receipt printers, cash-drawers) and ensure high availability during business hours.
	Maintain inventory and asset management for all IT equipment; track warranties and lifecycle replacement schedules.
	Implement and operate backup and recovery processes for critical systems and data; regularly test restores and document procedures.
	Monitor system health and alerts; proactively identify issues and drive remediation or capacity planning.
	Apply security best practices: endpoint protection, patch management, account hygiene, multi-factor authentication, and basic incident response/playbook execution.
	Maintain documentation: runbooks, SOPs, network diagrams, configuration files, change logs, and knowledge base articles for common user issues.
	Coordinate with third-party vendors (ISP, POS provider, printer service, cloud providers) and manage service tickets and SLAs.
	Support onboarding/offboarding processes for employees including device provisioning, access rights, and secure data removal.
	Assist with IT projects and upgrades (Wi?Fi expansion, workstation refresh, feature rollouts, Store Opening) ensuring continuous service availability.
	Ensure compliance with company policies and applicable regulations for data protection and privacy.
	Provide after-hours support on an as-needed rotation or for critical incidents.
	Collaborate across board to ensure highest level of customer service delivery.


Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Security, or related fields
	3+ years IT admin experience in SQL Database environment with on-
	3+ year Network (WAN/LAN) support for Multi branch (locations) architecture.
	Hands-on experience with Active Directory/Azure AD, Microsoft 365, Windows 10/11 imaging, network fundamentals (TCP/IP, VLANs, DHCP), and firewall configuration.
	Hands on experience is windows server, VM and cloud computing.
	Familiarity with backup solutions, endpoint security, and basic cloud services.
	Strong customer-service orientation, troubleshooting skills, and clear documentation practices.
	Certifications preferred: Microsoft 365 Certified, CompTIA Network+/Security+, or relevant vendor certifications is a plus.


We offer


	A competitive compensation and benefits package
	A collaborative environment where we support each other to succeed as a team
	A value-based culture
	A diverse and inclusive environment
	Great learning and growth opportunities


Note: We thank all applicants for their interest. We may not be able to respond to all applications, only those shortlisted for an interview will be contacted.

title: Job Vacancies at Phillips Outsourcing Limited
content:
Phillips Outsourcing Limited is a leading outsourcing service provider in Nigeria committed to delivering qualitative, customised, and effective outsourcing solutions to our esteemed clients.

Our innovative solutions have made us revered and renowned to be the go-to business partner for companies who want to scale-up and have a competitive edge in the market. With our workforce of highly skilled and experienced professionals, advanced technology and cost-effective mediums, our goal is to meet our client’s needs with precision.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Senior Print and UI Designer

Job Location: Lagos

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Consistently improve the visual impact of all our products while ensuring brand consistency and evolution.
	Co-lead the design and final production of critical print materials, including magazine, merchandise and marketing collateral.
	Own the print preparation process, including expert file setup, color management (CMYK), trapping, binding specifications, and collaboration with vendors to achieve premium results.
	Apply advanced knowledge of grid systems, hierarchy, and typography to enhance readability and visual interest in high-volume text layouts.
	Conceptualize, design, and iterate on highly functional and aesthetically pleasing user interfaces for web and mobile platforms using industry leading tools.
	Contribute significantly to the creation and maintenance of a comprehensive UI toolkit, including components, style guides, and documentation to ensure design scalability and developer efficiency.
	Translate user flows and wireframes into stunning visual designs that guide the user effectively and adhere to current best practices for interaction and accessibility.


Requirements


	5-7+ years of professional design experience with a proven portfolio demonstrating strong capabilities in both Print and UI Design.
	Expert proficiency in Adobe InDesign, Photoshop, and Illustrator for production-ready print work.
	Advanced proficiency in leading tools like Figma, Sketch, or Adobe XD for UI design, prototyping, and collaboration.
	Deep understanding of print production processes, high resolution imagery, colour management (CMYK), trapping, and pre- press standards.
	Strong command of component-based UI design patterns, visual hierarchy, layout systems, and platform-specific interface standards (web/mobile).
	Mastery of typographic principles, grid systems, and accessibility standards (WCAG).


Salary
N700,000 monthly.

Application Closing Date: 10th February, 2026.

Click here to apply online

 

 

2.) Regional Business Development Manager

Job Location: Owerr, Imo
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Head of Business Development will be responsible for identifying and pursuing new business opportunities, building relationships with potential clients, and driving the company's growth strategy.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, or related field.
	Minimum of 7 years of experience
	Proven experience in business development, sales, or related role.
	Strong networking and relationship-building skills.
	Excellent negotiation and communication abilities.
	Analytical and strategic thinking skills.
	Experience in the real estate industry is an advantage.


Key Responsibilities


	Identify and develop new business opportunities.
	Build and maintain relationships with key clients, partners, and stakeholders.
	Develop and implement business development strategies.
	Conduct market research and competitive analysis.
	Prepare and present business proposals and pitches.
	Collaborate with the marketing team to develop promotional materials.
	Track and report on business development activities and results.
	Negotiate contracts and agreements with clients.


Application Closing Date: 22nd February, 2026.

Click here to apply online

 

 

3.) Marketing Representative

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking an experienced airline industry professional to drive market growth, strengthen agency relationships, and represent our brand within the region.
	The ideal candidate must have proven experience in the airline or aviation sector with strong industry knowledge, agency relationships, and the ability to identify and develop new business opportunities.


Key Responsibilities


	Build and maintain strong relationships with travel agencies and aviation partners to drive sales.
	Leverage airline/aviation experience to identify market trends, competitor activities, and business opportunities.
	Promote company services, routes, and offerings across the region.
	Conduct agency visits and sales engagements to increase market share.
	Prepare monthly and annual market performance reports.
	Ensure all marketing and operational activities comply with aviation and company regulations.
	Report risks, incidents, and customer complaints promptly.
	Participate in relevant aviation and corporate trainings.
	Perform additional tasks as assigned by the supervisor.


Qualifications


	Mandatory: Previous experience in the airline or aviation industry (this role requires strong industry exposure).
	Bachelor's degree minimum.
	Excellent relationship-building, communication, and negotiation skills.
	Strong market research and analytical skills.
	Proactive, self-driven, and committed to continuous learning.
	Proficiency in English and local language(s).


Salary
N150,000 - N200,000 monthly.

Application Closing Date: 21st February, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: jobsbykyin@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: You’ll be reached out to immediately if you meet the requirements.

title: Field Recruitment Agent (Driver Onboarding) Job at Monochrome Convoy
content:
Monochrome Convoy is a fast-growing ride-hailing platform. We are building a movement that connects reliable drivers with passengers through seamless technology. We are looking for energetic, proactive, and street-smart candidates to join our team.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Field Recruitment Agent (Driver Onboarding)
Job Location: Warri, Delta
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are looking for energetic, proactive, and street-smart candidates to join our team.


The Role
     

            
    




	The primary goal is to get Monochrome Convoy moving on Deltaroads.
	You will be on the front lines, identifying potential drivers, pitching the benefits of our app, and completing their registration.


Key Responsibilities


	Identify Prospects: Locate and engage with car owners and commercial drivers across Warri, Sapele and Asaba(hubs, parks, and popular driver hangouts).
	Onboard: Guide drivers through the app download and sign-up process.
	Document Verification: Ensure all required documents (Driver’s License, Vehicle Paper, etc.) are correctly uploaded and clear.
	Activation: Ensure the driver account is fully registered and operational.
	Note: Full Training Provided. We will train all successful candidates on how to use the app, verify documents, and effectively onboard drivers to ensure you are successful from day one.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess an HND qualification.
	Young & Proactive: A go-getter attitude with the ability to work independently.
	Communication: Ability to speak clearly to drivers in English and Pidgin.
	Tech-Savvy: Comfortable using and explaining mobile applications.
	City Knowledge: Familiarity with major hubs, parks, and roads in Warri, Sapele & Asaba.


Earnings & Benefits


	Salary: N50,000 - N300,000 monthly
	This is a strictly commission-based role designed for high performers. We offer a competitive payout structure:
	Earn between N2,500 and N5,000 per driver recruited.
	Unlimited Earnings: The more you recruit, the more you earn—no limits!
	Growth: Top-performing agents will be prioritized for supervisor roles as we expand.


Method of Application 
Interested candidates should send their CV and a short introductory message to: transportappoperations@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: For more enquiries, contact via WhatsApp: 08108370266.    

    

        Click here to Apply
